intro: Impatiens pseudohamata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved impatiens, is a species of flowering plant in the family Balsaminaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically bright red or orange, with a distinctive spurred shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
